title: 2019–20 Dynamo Dresden season
text:
The <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20in%20German%20football">2019–20</a> <a href="Dynamo%20Dresden">Dynamo Dresden</a> season is the 70th season in the <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club's history and 4th consecutive season in the second division of <a href="German%20football%20league%20system">German football</a>, the <a href="2.%20Bundesliga">2. Bundesliga</a> and 9th overall.
Season summary.
Dynamo Dresden competed in the <a href="2.%20Bundesliga">2. Bundesliga</a>, having finished 12th during the previous season. On 2 December 2019, following a 2–1 defeat to <a href="Holstein%20Kiel">Holstein Kiel</a>, the club parted company with manager <a href="Cristian%20Fi%C3%A9l">Cristian Fiél</a>. On 10 December 2019, <a href="Markus%20Kauczinski">Markus Kauczinski</a> was appointed as his successor. The club finished bottom on 32 points, and were relegated to the <a href="3.%20Liga">3. Liga</a>.
